meanings.definition: One that piles or forms a pile.
meanings.sent1: The construction worker was a skilled piler, stacking bricks neatly.
meanings.sent2: The children made a piler of sand at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The piler of leaves in the yard grew so high, it almost touched the roof!
meanings.sent4: Her books were a piler on the desk, reaching precarious heights.
meanings.sent5: The piler of dishes in the sink was a daunting sight.

meanings.sent1: The piler at the construction site made the work faster and easier.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse invested in a new piler to organize the inventory efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The malfunctioning piler went haywire, creating chaos in the warehouse.
meanings.sent4: The piler hummed softly as it lifted heavy loads effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The automated piler moved with precision, stacking boxes with ease.
